name: Wearing the pants, ladies who lead
description: The pre-code 1932 feature, A Bill of Divorcement, a glass cinema slide of which features in the glass cinema slide display, stars John Barrymore and Katharine Hepburn in her screen debut.

key_work.title: Glass cinema slides
key_work.brief_description: These glass slides advertise films that charted the change from silent to sound cinema, as well as the changing face of cinema when the Motion Picture Production Code was established.

constellations_primary.name: Wearing the pants, ladies who lead
constellations_primary.description: The pre-code 1932 feature, A Bill of Divorcement, a glass cinema slide of which features in the glass cinema slide display, stars John Barrymore and Katharine Hepburn in her screen debut.

start.title: Morocco
start.creator_credit: Josef von Sternberg, Hector Turnbull, Paramount Pictures, Benno Vigny and Jules Furthman
start.brief_description: The Foreign Legion marches into Mogador with booze and women in mind just as singer Amy Jolly arrives from Paris to work at Lo Tinto’s cabaret. That night, insouciant legionnaire Tom Brown catches her inimitably seductive, tuxedo-clad act.

constellations_other.name: Wearing the pants, ladies who lead
constellations_other.description: The pre-code 1932 feature, A Bill of Divorcement, a glass cinema slide of which features in the glass cinema slide display, stars John Barrymore and Katharine Hepburn in her screen debut.

constellations_other.name: Marlene Dietrich: queering gender onscreen
constellations_other.description: Marlene Dietrich is an icon of queer style – from her proud bisexuality to her scandalous decision to wear a tuxedo on the red carpet. This constellation explores androgyny, gender non-conformity and drag on screen in the century since Dietrich's performance in Morocco (1930).

end.title: The Blue Angel
end.creator_credit: Josef von Sternberg, Tihamer Varady, Erich Pommer, UFA, Emil Hasler, Carl Winston, Carl Zuckmayer, Karl Vollmöller and Robert Liebmann
end.brief_description: Prim professor Immanuel Rath finds some of his students ogling photos of cabaret performer Lola Lola and visits a local club, The Blue Angel, to catch them there. When the teacher himself falls for Lola Lola, life becomes difficult.

constellations_other.name: Wearing the pants, ladies who lead
constellations_other.description: The pre-code 1932 feature, A Bill of Divorcement, a glass cinema slide of which features in the glass cinema slide display, stars John Barrymore and Katharine Hepburn in her screen debut.

links.description: Marlene Dietrich shot to international acclaim in Germany’s first feature-length talkie The Blue Angel directed by Josef von Sternberg, who brought Dietrich to Paramount. Dietrich and Sternberg would work on seven films together before their collaboration ended in 1935.

start.title: The Aviator
start.creator_credit: Charles Evans Jr., Graham King, Matthias Deyle, Michael Mann and Sandy Climan
start.headline_credit: Germany and United States of America, 2004

video_links.name: The Aviator | Official Trailer (HD) - Leonardo DiCaprio, Kate Beckinsale, Cate Blanchett | MIRAMAX

start.brief_description: A biopic charting the life of filmmaker and aviation magnate Howard Hughes between 1927 and 47, when his meteoric rise was impacted by his severe obsessive-compulsive disorder. Directed by Scorsese, digitally emulated the look of Technicolor to reflect the film’s era.

constellations_other.name: Communicating colour
constellations_other.description: An exploration of colour on-screen inspired by Technicolor supervisor, Natalie Kalmus.

constellations_other.name: Wearing the pants, ladies who lead
constellations_other.description: The pre-code 1932 feature, A Bill of Divorcement, a glass cinema slide of which features in the glass cinema slide display, stars John Barrymore and Katharine Hepburn in her screen debut.

constellations_other.name: Over the Technicolor rainbow
constellations_other.description: This Constellation explores the beginning and legacy of Technicolor and was created by Swinburne Cinema and Screen Studies students Adam Virgona and Kristian Vass.

constellations_other.name: Some like it hot
constellations_other.description: Australian costume designer Orry-Kelly had an eye for designing exceptional garments that worked for non-traditional Hollywood figures. His talent was highlighted when creating the gender non-conforming costumes for characters Joe / Josephine (Tony Curtis) and Jerry / Daphne (Jack Lemmon).

constellations_other.name: Movies in movies in a movie museum
constellations_other.description: The 400 Porto-Arc 16mm projector used the first electric light ever invented, which was perfectly suited for movie projectors. This Constellation explores the movies where characters go to the movies, by two movie-obsessed directors.

end.title: Elizabeth
end.creator_credit: Shekhar Kapur, Alexandra Byrne, Alison Owen, Eric Fellner, Tim Bevan, Channel Four Films, PolyGram Filmed Entertainment, Working Title Films, John Myhre and Michael Hirst
end.brief_description: The story of the ascension to the throne and the early reign of Queen Elizabeth the First, the endless attempts by her council to marry her off, the Catholic hatred of her and her romance with Lord Robert Dudley.

constellations_other.name: Wearing the pants, ladies who lead
constellations_other.description: The pre-code 1932 feature, A Bill of Divorcement, a glass cinema slide of which features in the glass cinema slide display, stars John Barrymore and Katharine Hepburn in her screen debut.

constellations_other.name: Some like it hot
constellations_other.description: Australian costume designer Orry-Kelly had an eye for designing exceptional garments that worked for non-traditional Hollywood figures. His talent was highlighted when creating the gender non-conforming costumes for characters Joe / Josephine (Tony Curtis) and Jerry / Daphne (Jack Lemmon).

links.description: No stranger to portraying real world leading ladies, Cate Blanchett also starred in the suspenseful historical drama Elizabeth in the title role of Queen Elizabeth I of England.

start.title: The Philadelphia Story
start.creator_credit: George Cukor, Adrian, Joseph L. Mankiewicz, Loew's Incorporated, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Donald Ogden Stewart and Waldo Salt
start.brief_description: When a rich woman’s ex-husband and a tabloid-type reporter turn up just before her planned remarriage, she begins to learn the truth about herself.

constellations_other.name: Wearing the pants, ladies who lead
constellations_other.description: The pre-code 1932 feature, A Bill of Divorcement, a glass cinema slide of which features in the glass cinema slide display, stars John Barrymore and Katharine Hepburn in her screen debut.

constellations_other.name: Some like it hot
constellations_other.description: Australian costume designer Orry-Kelly had an eye for designing exceptional garments that worked for non-traditional Hollywood figures. His talent was highlighted when creating the gender non-conforming costumes for characters Joe / Josephine (Tony Curtis) and Jerry / Daphne (Jack Lemmon).

end.title: Morocco
end.creator_credit: Josef von Sternberg, Hector Turnbull, Paramount Pictures, Benno Vigny and Jules Furthman
end.brief_description: The Foreign Legion marches into Mogador with booze and women in mind just as singer Amy Jolly arrives from Paris to work at Lo Tinto’s cabaret. That night, insouciant legionnaire Tom Brown catches her inimitably seductive, tuxedo-clad act.

constellations_other.name: Wearing the pants, ladies who lead
constellations_other.description: The pre-code 1932 feature, A Bill of Divorcement, a glass cinema slide of which features in the glass cinema slide display, stars John Barrymore and Katharine Hepburn in her screen debut.

constellations_other.name: Marlene Dietrich: queering gender onscreen
constellations_other.description: Marlene Dietrich is an icon of queer style – from her proud bisexuality to her scandalous decision to wear a tuxedo on the red carpet. This constellation explores androgyny, gender non-conformity and drag on screen in the century since Dietrich's performance in Morocco (1930).

links.description: Hepburn “lined up on the side of trousers for women” during a time when women could be arrested for wearing pants in public. Dietrich often challenged gender conformity on and off the screen, with Morocco famous for Dietrich performing cabaret in a man’s tailcoat.

start.title: Elizabeth
start.creator_credit: Shekhar Kapur, Alexandra Byrne, Alison Owen, Eric Fellner, Tim Bevan, Channel Four Films, PolyGram Filmed Entertainment, Working Title Films, John Myhre and Michael Hirst
start.brief_description: The story of the ascension to the throne and the early reign of Queen Elizabeth the First, the endless attempts by her council to marry her off, the Catholic hatred of her and her romance with Lord Robert Dudley.

constellations_other.name: Wearing the pants, ladies who lead
constellations_other.description: The pre-code 1932 feature, A Bill of Divorcement, a glass cinema slide of which features in the glass cinema slide display, stars John Barrymore and Katharine Hepburn in her screen debut.

constellations_other.name: Some like it hot
constellations_other.description: Australian costume designer Orry-Kelly had an eye for designing exceptional garments that worked for non-traditional Hollywood figures. His talent was highlighted when creating the gender non-conforming costumes for characters Joe / Josephine (Tony Curtis) and Jerry / Daphne (Jack Lemmon).

end.title: I'm Not There
end.creator_credit: Christine Vachon, James D. Stern, John Goldwyn and John Sloss
end.brief_description: Six actors portray six personas of music legend Bob Dylan in scenes depicting various stages of his life, chronicling his rise from unknown folksinger to international icon and revealing how Dylan constantly reinvented himself.

constellations_other.name: Wearing the pants, ladies who lead
constellations_other.description: The pre-code 1932 feature, A Bill of Divorcement, a glass cinema slide of which features in the glass cinema slide display, stars John Barrymore and Katharine Hepburn in her screen debut.

constellations_other.name: Making films in black and white
constellations_other.description: Oscar-winner Sandy Powell crafted Abigail's (Emma Stone) costume in The Favourite to represent her ascension in the royal household of Queen Anne by utilising black and white.

links.description: Blanchett once more flexed her biopic muscles in I’m Not There, this time, however, portraying Bob Dylan alongside five other actors all depicting different facets of Dylan’s public personas.

start.title: I'm Not There
start.creator_credit: Christine Vachon, James D. Stern, John Goldwyn and John Sloss
start.brief_description: Six actors portray six personas of music legend Bob Dylan in scenes depicting various stages of his life, chronicling his rise from unknown folksinger to international icon and revealing how Dylan constantly reinvented himself.

constellations_other.name: Wearing the pants, ladies who lead
constellations_other.description: The pre-code 1932 feature, A Bill of Divorcement, a glass cinema slide of which features in the glass cinema slide display, stars John Barrymore and Katharine Hepburn in her screen debut.

constellations_other.description: Oscar-winner Sandy Powell crafted Abigail's (Emma Stone) costume in The Favourite to represent her ascension in the royal household of Queen Anne by utilising black and white.

end.title: Mrs. America
end.creator_credit: Bina Daigeler, Boo Killebrew, Tanya Barfield, FX Productions, Gowanus Projections and Mara LePere-Schloop
end.brief_description: The true story of the movement to ratify the Equal Rights Amendment, and the unexpected backlash led by a conservative woman named Phyllis Schlafly, aka “the sweetheart of the silent majority.”

constellations_other.name: Wearing the pants, ladies who lead
constellations_other.description: The pre-code 1932 feature, A Bill of Divorcement, a glass cinema slide of which features in the glass cinema slide display, stars John Barrymore and Katharine Hepburn in her screen debut.

links.description: Mrs. America is a miniseries about the political movement to pass the Equal Rights Amendment in the US. Loosely based on conservative Phyllis Schlafly (Blanchett) who led an unexpected backlash. Fellow Australian, Rose Byrne stars as Gloria Steinem in the story of the 1970s culture wars.

start.brief_description: When a rich woman’s ex-husband and a tabloid-type reporter turn up just before her planned remarriage, she begins to learn the truth about herself.

constellations_other.description: Australian costume designer Orry-Kelly had an eye for designing exceptional garments that worked for non-traditional Hollywood figures. His talent was highlighted when creating the gender non-conforming costumes for characters Joe / Josephine (Tony Curtis) and Jerry / Daphne (Jack Lemmon).

end.headline_credit: Germany and United States of America, 2004

video_links.name: The Aviator | Official Trailer (HD) - Leonardo DiCaprio, Kate Beckinsale, Cate Blanchett | MIRAMAX

end.brief_description: A biopic charting the life of filmmaker and aviation magnate Howard Hughes between 1927 and 47, when his meteoric rise was impacted by his severe obsessive-compulsive disorder. Directed by Scorsese, digitally emulated the look of Technicolor to reflect the film’s era.

constellations_other.description: An exploration of colour on-screen inspired by Technicolor supervisor, Natalie Kalmus.

constellations_other.name: Wearing the pants, ladies who lead
constellations_other.description: The pre-code 1932 feature, A Bill of Divorcement, a glass cinema slide of which features in the glass cinema slide display, stars John Barrymore and Katharine Hepburn in her screen debut.

constellations_other.name: Over the Technicolor rainbow
constellations_other.description: This Constellation explores the beginning and legacy of Technicolor and was created by Swinburne Cinema and Screen Studies students Adam Virgona and Kristian Vass.

constellations_other.name: Some like it hot
constellations_other.description: Australian costume designer Orry-Kelly had an eye for designing exceptional garments that worked for non-traditional Hollywood figures. His talent was highlighted when creating the gender non-conforming costumes for characters Joe / Josephine (Tony Curtis) and Jerry / Daphne (Jack Lemmon).

constellations_other.name: Movies in movies in a movie museum
constellations_other.description: The 400 Porto-Arc 16mm projector used the first electric light ever invented, which was perfectly suited for movie projectors. This Constellation explores the movies where characters go to the movies, by two movie-obsessed directors.

links.description: In Martin Scorsese’s biopic of Howard Hughes, Hepburn was portrayed by Cate Blanchett, who won the Academy Award for Best Supporting Actress, marking the first instance where the portrayal of an Academy Award-winning actress itself won an Academy Award.

start.title: Glass cinema slides
start.brief_description: These glass slides advertise films that charted the change from silent to sound cinema, as well as the changing face of cinema when the Motion Picture Production Code was established.

constellations_primary.name: Wearing the pants, ladies who lead
constellations_primary.description: The pre-code 1932 feature, A Bill of Divorcement, a glass cinema slide of which features in the glass cinema slide display, stars John Barrymore and Katharine Hepburn in her screen debut.

end.title: The Philadelphia Story
end.creator_credit: George Cukor, Adrian, Joseph L. Mankiewicz, Loew's Incorporated, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Donald Ogden Stewart and Waldo Salt
end.brief_description: When a rich woman’s ex-husband and a tabloid-type reporter turn up just before her planned remarriage, she begins to learn the truth about herself.

constellations_other.name: Wearing the pants, ladies who lead
constellations_other.description: The pre-code 1932 feature, A Bill of Divorcement, a glass cinema slide of which features in the glass cinema slide display, stars John Barrymore and Katharine Hepburn in her screen debut.

constellations_other.name: Some like it hot
constellations_other.description: Australian costume designer Orry-Kelly had an eye for designing exceptional garments that worked for non-traditional Hollywood figures. His talent was highlighted when creating the gender non-conforming costumes for characters Joe / Josephine (Tony Curtis) and Jerry / Daphne (Jack Lemmon).

links.description: While heralded as a new star on the horizon, Hepburn went onto appear in several box office flops before securing the rights to the remarriage comedy, The Philadelphia Story and firmly returning to box office glory.
